session.name: Liberty Index 2021 - U.S. Senate
session.description: Created by the Republican Liberty Caucus, the 2021 Liberty Index is a liberty-focused legislative scorecard for the U.S. Senate. The Liberty Index scores Republican Senators on 20 pivotal bills/votes from 2021 that either advance liberty or diminish liberty.

bills.title: Senator Rand Paul's amendment would have required federal spending to gradually decrease every year for the next ten years
bills.description: Senator Rand Paul's amendment would have required federal spending to gradually decrease every year for the next ten years. (Failed 29-71 on 2/4/21) S.Con.Res. 5,                   Senator Mike Crapo's amendment would have permanently extended the lower tax rates for individuals and businesses, which had been established in 2017.

bills.description: The $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan Act of 2021. (Passed 50-49 on 3/6/21) PPP Extension Act of 2021. Extended the Paycheck Protection Program, which bails out businesses with taxpayer funded loans that aren't required to be paid back. bills.title: The United States Innovation and Competition Act of 2021
bills.description: The United States Innovation and Competition Act of 2021. Approves over $200 billion in new spending, expanding the Department of Energy and the National Science Foundation. Also violates free market principles by funding crony initiatives to incentivize "innovation." (Passed 68-32 on 6/8/21) Cloture on the motion to proceed with S.2093 - For The People Act of 2021. This would have federalized elections, removing local control and cancelling many state

bills.description: Extending Government Funding and Delivering Emergency Assistance Act. Funded the federal government through December 3, 2021.

(Failed 50-49 on 11/3/21. 60 votes required) The original draft of the National Defense Authorization Act of 2022. Increases military spending to $778 billion, expands the draft by requiring women to register for selective service, permits red-flag gun confiscation for military servicemembers, and includes critical race theory training for military servicemembers.

bills.description: Further Extending Government Funding Act. Funds the federal government through February 18, 2022, which includes funding for Biden's OSHA vaccine mandate. bills.title: Would have blocked President Biden's $650 million weapons sale to Saudi Arabia
bills.description: Would have blocked President Biden's $650 million weapons sale to Saudi Arabia. Saudi Arabia has not used U.S. weapons responsibly and their blockade on Yemen has resulted in famine and many civilian casualties.

bills.title: Repeals and defunds President Biden's unconstitutional OSHA vaccine mandate
bills.description: Repeals and defunds President Biden's unconstitutional OSHA vaccine mandate. (Passed 52-48 on 12/8/21) Cloture on the motion to concur in the House amendment to S. 610, which allowed the Senate to bypass the filibuster and raise the debt ceiling.
